title: Truffle not installing on Mac via Node
body: How do I get Truffle to install it keeps failing? I uninstalled and reinstalled and still get the same errors. at the end it always gives me a bash command not found type error. Screenshot below. Eric

Hey @ericlam1114, what version of npm and Node are you using? Currently we think there may be something up with npm version 7. So if you are using 7, maybe try downgrading to 6. Let me know how it goes if you try it!

Hi @eggplantzzz I am using node v14.16.1 and npm v6.14.12

Does this change anything?
"npx truffle" in the terminal brings up the command options. should i be interacting with truffle via npx instead of npm?

Hi @ericlam1114 can you try installing the latest Truffle version and testing again? I am unable to reproduce this error using the versions provided so I just want to make sure you are still experiencing this issue. Can you also tell us what Mac you are using? We have seen some issues with the new M1 so I just want to be sure how best to categorize what you're reporting. Thanks so much!

Hi @fainashalts I uninstalled and reinstalled Truffle. 

npm install -g truffle

Then I navigate to a folder I created on my desktop and enter:

npx truffle

That shows a loading bar in the terminal and appears to be setting up something in the folder

When finished it says Truffle v5.4.11 - a development framework for Ethereum and lists commands below. (build, compile, run, etc.)

I then open the folder I did npx truffle in and nothing is there. in my terminal i do:

truffle init 

it says "-bash: truffle: command not found" 

not sure how to get around this problem. This is a relatively small community so it's been hard to get support. 

My mac is version 10.13.6 macOS High Sierra
Macbook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2015)

Would love to use the program. Does this help?

Hey @ericlam1114, sorry for the delay in getting back to you! So this is not really a Truffle problem but rather it looks like there might be something up with your npm installation. You need to make sure that you have your npm bin directory in your $PATH variable. The $PATH variable contains all the directories that bash will look in for executables. I would recommend re-installing npm using nvm which is a Node version manager. This is what npm recommends and it should add to your $PATH. You can find an npm article that will tell you how you might go about doing this [here](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally). 

Give it a try and let me know how it goes!

Hi @eggplantzzz thanks for your reply. This might be a noob question on my end but what exactly is a $PATH variable? I have a mac and am not sure what that is? 

I'm trying to research it and have not found a clear answer.

Not a noob question at all. Here are two decent links to get you started, and hopefully they help. 
- [Stackexchange: What is path on a mac os](https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/111550/what-is-path-on-a-mac-os) 
- [wikipedia: PATH_(variable)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PATH_(variable))

@cds-amal thank you for your help. This makes sense I think. Theres a problem with the install path it sounds like. 

@eggplantzzz Thanks for your help. I read the docs you sent and ran the nvm manager install 

curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash

It's now giving me a couple more errors. 

=> Profile not found. Tried ~/.bashrc, ~/.bash_profile, ~/.zshrc, and ~/.profile

Then it says

npm ERR! invalid: readable-stream@1.0.27-1 /Users/lamsky1114/.npm-packages/lib/node_modules/myfirstapp/node_modules/npm/node_modules/sha/node_modules/readable-stream
npm ERR! invalid: string_decoder@0.10.25-1 /Users/lamsky1114/.npm-packages/lib/node_modules/myfirstapp/node_modules/npm/node_modules/sha/node_modules/readable-stream/node_modules/string_decoder

Do either of you know what these errors mean?

I really appreciate your help. This feels like going down a rabbit hole of error messages. I've never had this problem with React or any other library/framework. Thanks again for your patience and time.

The first message means it can't find a configuration file for the shell you are using. Looks like you are using bash, you could try creating it. Go ahead and just run `touch ~./bashrc`. Then try that script again.

Hi @eggplantzzz when I run the command touch ~./bashrc my computer says "no such file or directory".

I tried ~./bashrc and touch ~./bashrc. as well. I get the same thing each time. 

What do you think?

(would be willing to pay for you to remote into my computer and help btw). Either way, appreciate your help. Hopefully this is getting us closer :)
There's a typo in the filename. use: `touch ~/.bashrc` Sorry about that!

Thank you @cds-amal and @eggplantzzz 

So I did touch ~/.bashrc . No error messages which seems like a good thing. 

I installed nvm manager 

curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash

then created new folder on desktop called "Folder"

I did npm install -g truffle

Then I navigate to the folder I created on my desktop and enter:

npx truffle

That shows a loading bar in the terminal and appears to be setting up something in the folder

When finished it says Truffle v5.4.15 - a development framework for Ethereum and lists commands below. (build, compile, run, etc.)

I then open the folder I did npx truffle in and nothing is there. in my terminal i do:

truffle init

it says "-bash: truffle: command not found"

This is the same error I was having before. Am I missing something? Still doesn't seem to be working. 

What do you think?
Hi @ericlam1114 it could be nvm is installed but not properly configured. What's the output when you invoke the command `nvm ls` in a newly opened terminal?

@cds-amal I get 

-bash: nvm: command not found

I am getting a new mac in a few weeks. i'm going to try redoing this on my new computer and see if it works there. maybe my current computer is just messed up or something. 

I'll report back in a few weeks
@ericlam1114 Any updates on this?  Thanks!

I got a new macbook pro and started fresh. Didnâ€™t move any of my old files onto the computer. Downloaded vscode etc. Everything works perfectly. I probably had things installed in weird places on my old computer. Thank you everyone for your help.

Sent from my iPhone

> On Dec 22, 2021, at 2:29 PM, Harry Altman ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> ï»¿
> @ericlam1114 Any updates on this? Thanks!
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
OK, I'm going to go ahead and close this then if you don't mind!  Thanks again!

For anyone who might come across this issue. 

1. Create a `.zshrc` file under your `User` directory (the one that will have the `Desktop` and `Document` directories in it)
2. Locate your npm bin folder. Under your user folder you can type `ls -a` and look for `.npm-global` which you can `cd` into where you should see the `bin` folder
3. Note the path and add it to your `.zshrc` file by typing `echo .zshrc` and typing in the path like so: `export PATH=$PATH:~/.npm-global/bin` (i just put it underneath any other stuff I saw in there). Save it like you would save a vs code file (cmd + s)
4. Refresh the file from the terminal by typing `source .zshrc`
5. You should now be able to type `truffle` and see the available commands ðŸš€

~Use brew install truffle~

Edit: Truffle should only be installed from `npm`. We cannot vouch for `brew`.
@kwakyebrilliant, Please do not install Truffle from brew, we have no idea about that project and cannot vouch for it.
